byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Ellen Barry from Kathmandu, Nepal.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and ELLEN BARRY

abstract: Police in Bangladesh suspect Islamist militants in killing of gay rights activist Julhas Mannan and his friend, who were hacked to death with machetes; Mannan had previously received death threats for organizing gay and transgender rally that was cancelled.
lead_paragraph: Julhas Mannan, who had helped organize a march for gay and transgender youths, was the victim of what the police believe to be the latest in a wave of targeted killings.

headline.main: Bangladesh Gay Rights Activist Is Hacked to Death
headline.print_headline: Islamist Militants Suspected in Killing of Gay Rights Activist in Bangladesh

snippet: Julhas Mannan, who had helped organize a march for gay and transgender youths, was the victim of what the police believe to be the latest in a wave of targeted killings.
